titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Undated list of preemption warrants that are fully completed from the Virginia Land Office, undated
titlestmt.author: Claire Radcliffe

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid derived from derived from MARC record by Claire Radcliffe, 8 September 2014

titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Undated list of preemption warrants that are fully completed from the Virginia Land Office, undated
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia LOI 38
titlepage.author: Claire Radcliffe

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Undated list of preemption warrants that are fully completed from the Virginia Land Office, undated

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia. Land Office. A Guide to the Undated list of preemption warrants that are fully completed from the Virginia Land Office, undated. Accession Land Office inventory entry no. 38, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Archives Branch, Richmond, VA 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession LOI 38 transferred by the Secretary of the Commonwealth, 1948.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The act which established the previous Land Office next hit passed the General Assembly on 22 June 1779. The register was the head of the Office and was appointed by joint ballot of both houses of the legislature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These records contain a list compiled in the 19th century of approximately 115 preemption warrants giving the name of the warrantee, the number of acres in the warrant, and it number. Grants were issued on the basis of these warrants in the years 1781-1783, 1785, 1786, and 1800.
